intro: Onosma nigricaulis, commonly known as black-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Onosma nigricaulis is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
